image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman wearing white speaks in front of blue signage

props.synopsis: The Coalition's spokesperson for government efficiency, Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, tells a crowd of supporters in Perth that the party would "make Australia great again". Less than an hour later, she says she didn't realise she had echoed the US president's rallying cry.

title.children: Coalition senator vows to 'make Australia great again', dismisses Donald Trump link

image.altText: A close up of Opposition Leader Peter Dutton touching his glasses.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has resorted to relentless social media posts about the prime minister falling off a stage and lying about it.

title.children: The PM's fall won't distract from the Coalition's lack of policy detail

image.altText: A man sits on a rock on top of a mountain wearing a colourful shirt and white shorts

props.synopsis: The family of a Perth man who died while hiking in the Swiss Alps say he "achieved more than most would in a lifetime" and that he died doing something "he truly loved".

title.children: Australian hiker killed in Swiss Alps died doing something 'he truly loved'

image.altText: Daylesford fire

props.synopsis: Authorities have issued warnings about a bushfire in Victoria’s central-west after fire crews lost control of a planned burn near Daylesford.

title.children: Fire crews lose control of planned burn, residents told 'prepare to leave'

image.altText: Two plain-clothes detectives escorting a man through the doors of a building

props.synopsis: Child killer Rick Thorburn has been found dead in his prison cell almost 10 years after murdering schoolgirl Tiahleigh Palmer.

title.children: Schoolgirl Tiahleigh Palmer's killer found dead in cell

props.synopsis: Australian grain-fed beef exports to China are surging as the trade war with the US escalates, but some are warning of a bigger, more worrying picture.

title.children: Australian exports surge into gap as US-China tariffs beef heats up

image.altText: GettyImages-2209227148

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs get out to a 39-point lead but the Lions fight back in a classic clash at Norwood. Follow live.

title.children: Lions complete stunning comeback against the Dogs as unlikely hero stars

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Brisbane Lions 18.10 (118) defeats Western Bulldogs 14.13 (97)

image.altText: Euan Aitken throws the ball in the air to celebrate a try in an NRL game against North Queensland.

props.synopsis: Just 31,347 fans turn up to Perth Stadium to watch as Souths and the Cowboys try to join Cronulla as victors in the NRL double header in Western Australia. Follow live.

title.children: Cowboys, Sharks win in front of smallest crowd for Perth double-header

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Crowd numbers well down on previous Perth double headers

image.altText: Early morning sun shining through steam clouds billowing from a nuclear power plant and transmissions lines.

props.synopsis: New data from the ABC's Vote Compass survey shows respondents are divided on nuclear energy, while support for climate change action appears to have softened.

title.children: Nuclear energy divides Australia, but data shows our stance may be shifting

image.altText: A photo of Bella Thorne. She has long brown hair,  brown eyes, red eyeshadow.

props.synopsis: Bella Thorne has accused fellow actor Mickey Rourke of on-set misconduct after singer JoJo Siwa's "homophobic" slur claims.

title.children: Thorne accuses Rourke of bruising her genitals with a metal grinder on set

image.altText: An aerial shot of sandy desert meeting an inland lake with blue skies.

props.synopsis: The deluge which battered south-west Queensland is now draining downhill to a catchment area five times the size of the UK.

title.children: Outback attraction to face largest fill in 15 years due to floodwaters

image.altText: A map projecting the path of a tropical low forming into a cyclone on Sunday.

props.synopsis: Preparations are under way in Western Australia's north for a tropical cyclone likely to form off the state's northern coast early on Sunday.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Errol could intensify to category 3 over Kimberley

image.altText: Elon Musk and Donald Trump embrace on a red stage.

props.synopsis: Shawn Monper, 32, is accused of threatening to kill US President Donald Trump, his billionaire ally Elon Musk and top government officials and agents in several comments he made online.

title.children: 'We need to start killing people': Man threatened Trump and Musk, US says

image.altText: a man in ablue jacket speaking to media behind a microphone

props.synopsis: Queensland's health minister says Monash IVF is being monitored after the wrong embryo was transferred to a patient at a Brisbane clinic.

title.children: Health officials watching Monash IVF after embryo transfer bungle

image.altText: Undated image of brothers Erik (L) and Lyle Menendez in a court room.

props.synopsis: Hearings that could result in the Menendez brothers being re-sentenced or released will be allowed to go ahead this week, after a judge knocked back prosecutors' attempts to scuttle them.

title.children: Menendez brothers face second chance as re-sentencing hearing goes ahead

image.altText: A black-and-white photo shows a woman with shoulder-length dark hair smiling while holding a smiling child

props.synopsis: Maria Voulgaris has this grainy image to remind her of her mother, who is behind bars for a crime she says she didn't knowingly commit.

title.children: This photo shows a mother’s love that’s now separated by 'oceans'

image.altText: Actor Eric Dane wearing glasses on a red carpet

props.synopsis: The Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria star says he will continue to work and is grateful to have his family by his side.

title.children: What is ALS? The motor neurone disease actor Eric Dane has been diagnosed with

image.altText: Hundreds of white cars sit parked next to each other in rows in front of stacked shipping containers

props.synopsis: As the United States and China continue escalating the trade war, economists say Australian consumers and businesses could benefit from cheaper prices.

title.children: 'What's not to like': Australians could benefit from US-China tariff war

image.altText: Three people walk up stairs

props.synopsis: Businesses planning on forcing their workers back to the office full-time may be reconsidering after the backlash to the Liberals' work-from-home crackdown.

title.children: Businesses may reconsider holding staff 'captive' after Liberals work policy backlash

image.altText: Eamon Lynham sitting on a couch wearing a black shirt and glasses.

props.synopsis: As Australians face roadblocks to find clinical trials, doctors are calling for a reform of the system to improve access to potentially life-saving studies.

title.children: 'I never realised I could feel grief so deep': Former politician loses son to brain cancer

image.altText: Aston Martin driver Fernando Alonso sitting in his car, in the pits, as mechanics work on the car

props.synopsis: Two-time Formula 1 world champion Fernando Alonso had steering issues during Friday's practice in Bahrain, leading the Aston Martin driver's steering wheel being dislodged while on track.

title.children: Alonso's steering wheel comes off while on track during F1 practice

image.altText: Image of a collection of purple carrots and plums.

props.synopsis: A plum bred in Queensland is showing promise in the fight against dementia. Australian researchers are testing whether an extract from the fruit can boost brain health.

title.children: Could a plum grown in Queensland help prevent dementia? Scientists hope so

image.altText: Adam Scott plays a shot in the sand

props.synopsis: Adam Scott is one of several Australians to have a day to forget in Augusta as Rory McIlroy roars into contention.

title.children: Scott records unwanted 16-year first in horror Masters day for Australians

image.altText: The outside of the Royal Children's Hospital in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital plans to axe the jobs due to a reduction in philanthropic funding, with the Victorian opposition labelling the decision "appalling".

title.children: Royal Children's Hospital to cut jobs at cancer centre due to funding reduction

image.altText: Two detectives squat while looking at something on the ground.

props.synopsis: Police are calling for public assistance after a man was injured in an afternoon shooting outside a property in Melbourne's north on Friday.

title.children: Melbourne north shooting injuring 22yo man was 'targeted attack'

image.altText: A woman clad in a burkha takes an aid package from a UN worker in Afghanistan.

props.synopsis: Afghans in the US and Pakistan are facing the prospect of being sent back to Taliban-controlled Afghanistan amid crackdowns on those who have sought protection in the countries.

title.children: US and Pakistan threaten Afghan migrants with deportation

image.altText: Generic flu, influenza, cold, sniffle shot.

props.synopsis: The earlier than normal arrival of this year's flu season has doctors urging Australians to roll up their sleeves to get vaccinated.

title.children: The best time to get a flu shot for expected 'severe' season

image.altText: Jodie and Adam Knell - pls blur baby's face (2)

props.synopsis: Former members of strict religious groups have told the ABC about their loved ones shunning them after they left, breaking their families apart.

title.children: Jodie and Adam were happy in their church community — then came the split

image.altText: A woman wearing blue scrubs has her arm around an older woman wearing a pink cardigan as they walk across a lush green lawn.

props.synopsis: Senior Australians wanting to stay living at home independently for longer have concerns about new, national charges for services such as showering, cleaning and gardening; and how the co-payments will affect them.

title.children: 'Dismal, pathetic, horrific': Older Australians brace to pay more for home care

image.altText: a man wearing a t-shirt and a cap with a bull on it

props.synopsis: A US federal judge has rebuked a government lawyer who has been unable explain what the Trump administration had done to arrange for the return of a father who has been mistakenly deported to a notorious prison in El Salvador.

title.children: White House ordered to reveal plans to return man wrongly deported to El Salvador prison

image.altText: People jump off rocky coastline into water.

props.synopsis: Four of Western Australia's last five fatal great white shark attacks have occurred in a remote tourist hotspot. Locals worry the tragic recent history will continue.

title.children: Growing calls for action after tourist region's latest fatal shark attack

image.altText: Brown floodwater stretching to the horizon swirls across a muddy road.

props.synopsis: Thousands of kilometres of outback Queensland roads have been destroyed by floods, forcing cattle trucks on huge detours, doubling freight bills and leaving families on remote properties feeling even more isolated.

title.children: After flood devastation, graziers face roads to ruin

image.altText: Nyadol Nyuon looks at the camera seriously.

props.synopsis: A high-profile lawyer asked to oversee the delivery of a $800,000 Victorian workplace safety project says she left early, after it instead left her feeling "victimised" in her own job.

title.children: Lawyer says project to protect women at work ended in 'perfect failure'

image.altText: Kaitlan Leaney of the Waratahs celebrates after scoring a try, lying on top of the ball in goal

props.synopsis: The NSW Waratahs are champions of Super Rugby Women's, defeating the Queensland Reds in a gripping final.

title.children: Super Rugby Women's: Waratahs defeat Reds in final to claim sixth championship
